title: Trump's Attorney General 'met Priti Patel as he sought British help investigating Russian inquiry'
text:
Donald Trump's Attorney General met Home Secretary Priti Patel to seek help in investigating the inquiry into Russian meddling during the 2016 US election, it has been claimed.

Attorney General William Barr met Ms Patel in London on July 29, shortly after she landed the role of Home Secretary, where they attended a conference for the Five Eyes intelligence-sharing alliance, according to the Daily Telegraph.

Their meeting came days after Mr Trump reportedly asked Prime Minister Boris Johnson to assist him as he tried to discredit the Mueller investigation into possible connections between Russia and his election campaign.

Home Secretary Priti Patel shakes hands with US Attorney General at a conference for the Five Eyes intelligence-sharing alliance on July 29

US Attorney General William Barr (pictured) is claimed to have met Home Secretary Priti Patel to seek British help investigating the inquiry into Russian meddling during the 2016 US election

Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab told the Commons on Wednesday that no British government member, including the prime minister, would collude with Trump to discredit intelligence agencies looking into Russian interference of the 2016 election campaign.

The president also contacted Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison to ask for help in the US Attorney General's investigation of Special Counsel's Robert Mueller's Russia probe.

An Australian government spokesman confirmed the conversation took place.

Home Secretary Priti Patel speaking at the Conservative Party annual conference in Manchester who is claimed to have met Mr Barr at a conference for the Five Eyes intelligence-sharing alliance

'The Australian government has always been ready to assist and co-operate with efforts that help shed further light on the matters under investigation,' the spokesman told Australian Associated Press on Tuesday.

Mr Trump claims that the decision to investigate Kremlin links before the 2016 presidential election was improper.

Attorney General Mr Barr is overseeing the investigation by US Attorney for the District of Connecticut John Durham.

Mr Trump claims that the decision to investigate Kremlin links before his 2016 presidential election was improper

Mr Johnson's Attorney General Geoffrey Cox also met Mr Barr at the Five Eyes conference and said had the investigation been raised he would have declined to talk about it.

A UK Home Office spokesman said: 'Investigations in the US are a matter for the US authorities. We won't comment on the ongoing investigations.'
description: Attorney General William Barr (right) met Priti Patel (left) in London, where they attended a conference for the Five Eyes intelligence-sharing alliance.
